subject: How to test code that spawns threads (and throws exceptions)?

messageBody:
Hi,

I've been playing with JUnit and unit testing in general for a couple
of months now. Overall it's been a pretty rewarding experience. I
often find myself scurrying to the bookstore (or google) to read up on
various topics that come up. Today I finally ran into something I
couldn't solve cleanly: how does one write tests for code that spawns
threads, where the threads can throw exceptions? I'm specifically
looking at the JMF library. In many cases the caller of the code
doesn't have any direct access to the threads that are spawned.
Unless I've missed something it looks as if JUnit does not deal with
this situation. What's a good strategy for dealing with this?
ThreadGroup might help some, but only in cases where I can get access
to the spawned threads.

Any insights appreciated.
